champ.champInfo:
The overall management of the organization and conduct of competitions is carried out by the Ministry of Youth and Sports of Ukraine (hereinafter - the Ministry of Youth Sports) together with the NGO "National Kyokushinkai Karate Federation of Ukraine" (hereinafter - the Federation). The direct holding of the competitions is entrusted to the Department of Youth and Sports of the executive body of the Kyiv City Council (Kyiv City State Administration), the Kyiv Sports Club "Kodo-kan", the Main Board of Judges, approved by the Federation

Organizing committee and judges:

  • Chief judge of the competition - judge of the international sensei category Zhadan Anton Oleksandrovych, 3rd dan (Kyiv)
  • Technical support — Tatarchenko I.Yu. (Lviv)

All information on the tournament regulations and information for coaches in the telegram channel at the following link: Fighters of the nation

Registration

Registration for participation in the competition takes place through a personal account until April 15, 2024. Or to the e-mail of the organizing committee:
(hidden) or (hidden)
Contact numbers:
Secretary of NFKKU senpai Yulia Tsekhemstruk: +38(093) 379-17-57, +38(067) 964-90-12
Ihor Tatarchenko: +38(067)-788-77-28

The date and place of the competition

The competition will be held in Kyiv, April 26-28, 2024.
Date of arrival - April 26, 2024.
Venue – Palace of Sports, address: Sports Square, bldg. 1.
Competition starts on April 27 at 11:00

Competition program

April 26 (Friday):

  • 08:00 – 16:00 registration and weighing of athletes. Please note that the attendance of participants, coaches, judges and team representatives is mandatory! During the mandate commission, everyone will receive badges for entering the sports complex.Registration is not possible on April 27!
  • 16:00 - 18:00 judges' seminar, formation of judges' teams
  • 18:00 - 19:00 draw of competition participants

April 27 (Saturday):

  • 08:00-08:15 gathering of all participants, coaches, judges and team representatives
  • 08:30-08:45 meeting of the technical secretariat of the competition
  • 08:45-09:00 meeting of competition judges
  • 09:00-09:40 preparation for the ceremonial opening of the first day of the competition
  • 10:00-11:00 ceremonial opening of the first day of the competition
  • 11:00-19:00 qualifying competitions

April 28 (Sunday):

  • 08:00-08:15 gathering of all participants, coaches, judges and team representatives
  • 08:30-08:45 meeting of the technical secretariat of the competition
  • 08:45-09:00 meeting of competition judges
  • 09:00-09:40 preparation for the ceremonial opening of the first day of the competition
  • 10:00-11:00 ceremonial opening of the first day of the competition
  • 11:00-18:00 final part of the competition
  • 18:00-19:00 awarding of winners and prize-winners of the competition, closing of the competition

Competition participants.

  • Young athletes born in 2010-2015, who are members of the national teams of sports organizations that have concluded cooperation agreements with the NFKKU, foreign WKO teams and teams of sports organizations of Ukraine from other types of full-contact karate participate in open competitions
  • Participants of the competition must have a sports qualification not lower than the 3rd youth division of the EUCU (for members of the NFKKU) and/or a qualification degree not lower than the 10th kyu for members of invited teams of sports organizations of Ukraine from other types of full-contact karate sports
  • Male and female participants compete in separate sections of the competition
  • Participants will compete in personal helmets of the established model, which must contain transparent plastic visors (masks). Helmets should be red (for AKA) and white (for GRAY)
  • Participants will compete without body protectors!
  • Groin and shin protectors (white, soft, elastic, fastening - "stocking"), hand protectors (white, soft, elastic, fastening - "stocking"), chest protector (for girls, worn under a white t-shirt without inscriptions and drawings) are personal and mandatory
  • Participants, both male and female, must have personal groin protectors (in case of their absence 1 minute after the call to the match, disqualification will be announced)
  • The use of soft knee protectors is allowed (soft, elastic, fastening - "stocking")
  • All participants must provide protectors for inspection and marking at the mandate committee during the weigh-in

Make teams.

    If, based on previous applications, there are insufficient numbers of participants for a quality competition in certain categories, the Organizing Committee may make the following changes to the Regulations for these competitions:
  • merge bordering weight categories
  • hold competitions in specified weight categories in a round-robin fashion

Competition conditions

Competitions are held in accordance with the "Kyokushinkai Karate Competition Rules" in force in Ukraine. Team qualifying is common for male and female participants. To determine the places of teams based on individual and team championships, the results of only those participants who are included in the qualifying teams will be taken into account. The standings of the teams are finally determined by the mandate committee. Team points are calculated according to the rules of kyokushinkai karate competitions in force in Ukraine

Financing

Competitions are financed at the expense of the Department of Youth and Sports of the Executive Body of the Kyiv City Council (Kyiv City State Administration), awarding of cubes is at the expense of a separate division and other non-budgetary revenues.

Awards

Athletes who took 1-3 places are awarded diplomas of the Federation of the respective degrees, medals and valuable prizes of the competition organizers. Teams that took 1-3 places are awarded diplomas of the Federation of the respective degrees

Athletes', coaches' and judges' questionnaires for the "Sports Result" computer database are attached to the application. The application letter for participation in the established form, other necessary documents and insurance poles are submitted to the mandate commission during the medical commission and weighing of the participants. Teams that have confirmed their participation within the set deadline are admitted to the competition
